body:
@caarlos0 yes, that works  fine for building the binary. 
The issue is about making a created tar archive also reproducible

if you only have the binary in the archive, and the binary is reproducible, it should be reproducible too... did you find something different?

also, the options you linked can't be used because goreleaser does not use `tar`.

> if you only have the binary in the archive, and the binary is reproducible, it should be reproducible too... did you find something different?

I had a deeper look, I think it's only missing to be able to enforce the uid/gid for the main binary in the tar archive.

I can't find a way to specify it, for additional files it can be set in `archives.files.src.info:`.

This does not work:

```yml
project_name: "example"
builds:
  - goos:
      - linux
    goarch:
      - amd64
archives:
  - format: tar.xz
    files:
      - none*
      - src: 'example'
        strip_parent: true
        info:
          owner: 0
```

```sh
$ tree
.
├── go.mod
└── main.go

0 directories, 2 files
$ cat main.go
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
	fmt.Println("HELLO")
}
$ cat go.mod
module goreleaserexample

go 1.19
```

result:
```
error=failed to find files to archive: globbing failed for pattern example: matching "./example": file does not exist
```

ah yes, you won't be able to add it via `files`. I think we need to add a `mod_owner` or something like that in the build as well.

Or, just reuse the same structure and have a `info` field.

Thanks for the suggestion!

issue.title: feat: set file info for binaries inside archives

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.title: ci: release process is not reproducible

repository.name: cue
repository.description: The home of the CUE language! Validate and define text-based and dynamic configuration

issue.body:
### What version of CUE are you using (`cue version`)? 
$ cue version
n/a
### Does this issue reproduce with the latest release? Yes ### What did you do? Run the release process repeatedly locally: ``` rm -rf dist (cd internal/ci/goreleaser/ && GORELEASER_CURRENT_TAG=v0.4.3 GOCACHE=$(mktemp -d) cue cmd release) mv dist dist1 (command cd internal/ci/goreleaser/ && GORELEASER_CURRENT_TAG=v0.4.3 GOCACHE=$(mktemp -d) cue cmd release) mv dist dist2 sha256sum dist1/cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz dist2/cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz ``` ### What did you expect to see? Identical sums. ### What did you see instead? Different sums: ``` 58e678fa4828965c3211f27a1062e14b2bd4424a17a6b62cd2efe3bfd31ed585 dist1/cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz 836441f9b8bf190d17ef8f5a211ef7be802b74392cf9bcc9eadf4d0a5dd86a8c dist2/cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz ``` What's worse is that the `cue` binaries in any given release artefact are also different: ``` mkdir dist1/out mkdir dist2/out cd dist1/out tar -zxvf ../cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz cd ../../dist2/out tar -zxvf ../cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz cd ../../ sha256sum dist1/out/cue dist2/out/cue ``` gives: ``` 58e678fa4828965c3211f27a1062e14b2bd4424a17a6b62cd2efe3bfd31ed585 dist1/cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz 836441f9b8bf190d17ef8f5a211ef7be802b74392cf9bcc9eadf4d0a5dd86a8c dist2/cue_v0.4.3_linux_arm64.tar.gz ``` cc @seh

body:
@caarlos0 we've also just run into this when creating `.tar.gz` artefacts:

https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/issues/2177

I tried out https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/pull/3618 but that didn't seem to work for me.

Please let us know if we can provide more information from our side to help with this?
@myitcv I made a PR at #3618, can you try it out? Hopefully it fixes this :)

> @myitcv I made a PR at #3618, can you try it out? Hopefully it fixes this :)

As I commented above in https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/3582#issuecomment-1342384882, that PR doesn't fix things for me unfortunately. 

> I tried out https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/pull/3618 but that didn't seem to work for me.

@myitcv weird, I just tried it on goreleaser's build and it works... can you check the contents of the archives of 2 consecutive builds to see whats different?

for reference, this is the diff of what I did on goreleaser's config: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/pull/3618/commits/381a11b15ece27b08511d50b668fdf016e4d4c01

@caarlos0 here's a test that demonstrates the problem:

```
# Test to show that goreleaser .tar.gz artefacts are not reproducible.
# The key here is the setting of GOCACHE to a new directory. This
# correctly simulates building a release binary with the same sha256sum
# (assuming -trimpath etc are used) but which has different timestamps
# because it was created fresh.

# To test https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/pull/3618
# uncomment the following line
# mv .goreleaser.yaml.new .goreleaser.yaml

# run1
env GOCACHE=$WORK/cache1
exec goreleaser release --rm-dist --snapshot
exec sha256sum dist/hello_world_Linux_arm64.tar.gz
cp stdout run1

# run2
env GOCACHE=$WORK/cache2
exec goreleaser release --rm-dist --snapshot
exec sha256sum dist/hello_world_Linux_arm64.tar.gz
cp stdout run2

# Ensure the sums from both runs are identical
cmp run1 run2

-- go.mod --
module mod.com

go 1.18
-- main.go --
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
	fmt.Println("Hello, world")
}
-- .goreleaser.yaml --
project_name: hello_world
gomod:
  proxy: true
before:
  hooks:
    - go mod tidy
    - go generate ./...
builds:
  - env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    flags:
      - -trimpath
    ldflags:
      - -s -w
    goos:
      - linux
      - windows
      - darwin

archives:
  - format: tar.gz
    name_template: >-
      {{ .ProjectName }}_
      {{- title .Os }}_
      {{- if eq .Arch "amd64" }}x86_64
      {{- else if eq .Arch "386" }}i386
      {{- else }}{{ .Arch }}{{ end }}
      {{- if .Arm }}v{{ .Arm }}{{ end }}
    format_overrides:
    - goos: windows
      format: zip
checksum:
  name_template: 'checksums.txt'
snapshot:
  name_template: "{{ incpatch .Version }}-next"
changelog:
  sort: asc
  filters:
    exclude:
      - '^docs:'
      - '^test:'

-- .goreleaser.yaml.new --
project_name: hello_world
gomod:
  proxy: true
before:
  hooks:
    - go mod tidy
    - go generate ./...
builds:
  - env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    flags:
      - -trimpath
    ldflags:
      - -s -w
    goos:
      - linux
      - windows
      - darwin

archives:
  - format: tar.gz
    name_template: >-
      {{ .ProjectName }}_
      {{- title .Os }}_
      {{- if eq .Arch "amd64" }}x86_64
      {{- else if eq .Arch "386" }}i386
      {{- else }}{{ .Arch }}{{ end }}
      {{- if .Arm }}v{{ .Arm }}{{ end }}
    format_overrides:
    - goos: windows
      format: zip
    builds_info:
      group: root
      owner: root
checksum:
  name_template: 'checksums.txt'
snapshot:
  name_template: "{{ incpatch .Version }}-next"
changelog:
  sort: asc
  filters:
    exclude:
      - '^docs:'
      - '^test:'
```

The problem is that with a clear `GOCACHE`, then the binaries generated by `go build` have different timestamps. They have identical `sha256sum` values, but different timestamps. Hence, the test of simply running two consecutive builds is not sufficient AFAICT. 

The test above: 

* fails on current tip ddf7660b6d6621804c15cbbb3864a66de9f06876
* fails against #3618 (381a11b15ece27b08511d50b668fdf016e4d4c01), even with the uncommenting shown in the test above
* succeeds against a hack PR I put together in #3635 (c56e015c46334bf5695867f5c11f23116857cec7)

Please use from #3635 whatever you want. I'm quite happy for you to close it and submit a proper more clean fix. It was just a proof of concept.
